availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Coleman Spencer Daniel (Carroll County, Kentucky, resident and 1st Lieutenant 15th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.))

body.p: Carroll County, Kentucky, resident and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of William Daniel and Mary E. Daniel. Student in Carroll County in 1850. Resident of Carroll County in 1860. Served in the 15th Kentucky Infantry (U.S.A.) as private and 1st lieutenant from December 14, 1861 to February 20, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carroll County, District 2, p. 208a.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Carroll County, District 2, p. 56.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 282.
"Coleman Spencer Daniel (1842-1898)," Find A Grave, Memorial #65818868, accessed November 12, 2020, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/65818868.
